desc: a keyword used in a class or method definition, which specifies that the method/class is not going to be instantiated, but should be inherited by other methods or classes.
(Application Programming Interface) – is the way to expose a set of pre-defined classes and interfaces to external clients to interact with them, without sharing the implementation details
an input specified in a method call; it can be a literal value, a variable, or an expression - void fooMethod(int argument1);
a fixed-size collection of data of the same type, which can hold zero or more items - int[] array = new int[16];
automatic conversion between the primitive types and their corresponding object wrapper classes.
code between two matching open and close braces, which is the single logical unit of work inside the application - { some code }
a primitive type, holding only two values – true or false boolean condition = false;
a statement used to exit a loop/switch statement/labeled block; the application continues execution with the statement immediately following the containing block
a primitive type of the size of eight bits - byte b = 100;
the instruction set for Java Virtual Machine, created from source files into bytecode by the compiler
a keyword that defines a particular group of statements executed in a switch statement
conversion from one data type to another
the block of code inside try/catch statement, responsible for handling exceptions
a keyword used to declare a variable of single type character - char a = 'a';
an Exception that is caught at the compilation time, usually in the block or thrown in the method header

the core type in Java that defines the implementation of a particular kind of object; it defines instance and class variables and methods, as well as specifies the interfaces it implements and the immediate superclass of the class, by default Object - public class Foo {}
a synonym of static class
a synonym of a static field or a static variable
an environment variable or a command-line argument indicating the path searched by the Java compiler and the runtime for class definitions
a piece of explanatory text ignored by the compiler
a program used to translate source code into the code executed by a computer
it is the ability of a program to run several tasks in parallel, a primary feature of multithreading
a boolean expression controlling a conditional statement or loop - if (condition) {}
a final variable in Java, which means that the reference of it cannot be changed once initialized - final int number = 20;
a method inside the class, which creates and initializes objects in it – needs to be public and names the same as the class
a keyword used to resume application execution at the end of the current loop
please refer to block
officially, this is defined as a statement that establishes an identifier and associates attributes with it, without necessarily reserving its storage or providing the implementation
the optional destination used in a switch statement, when neither case statement matches the requested behavior
a declaration that reserves storage (for data) or provides an implementation (for methods)
a class/method/interface that has been made obsolete by later versions of the library or of the language itself; it should not be used as there is no guarantee that it will exist in future versions
a recursion that starts in the stack of the calling method itself
a keyword used to declare a while loop ensuring execution of the first iteration of the loop before the check of the boolean condition
Document Object Model, defined by the W3C, that allows applications to dynamically access and update the content, structure, and style of documents
a process of changing the data type from Object to the particular type, i.e., Integer
a keyword used in if/else condition statements, executed when the test condition is false
the process of protecting the state of objects by defining its attributes as private and channeling access to them through accessor and mutator methods
a Java keyword used to declare the enumerated type (whose values are a fixed set of constants)
an exceptional circumstance preventing the program to continue working regularly (usually an error or bug); here are some best practices to deal with and further understand exceptions in Java
a combination of operands and operators which causes particular behavior and produces results
a keyword used to define the inheritance of classes or interfaces
a variable defined outside of all defined methods, but inside of the class; in other words, a member of a class
a Java keyword indicating that an entity is immutable, thus, you can’t change its reference during the program execution - final int number = 20;
a block in a try/catch statement executed even Java exception or runtime error occurred
a Java keyword used to define a floating point number variable - float cash = 24.5;
a Java control structure used for loop execution
the process by which the JVM automatically frees up unused memory; to go further into the GC process and potential problems in that process, you can read the deep-dive into memory leaks here
a variable that is visible to all methods in the class
graphical user interface
a value used to provide an efficient way to map object and its location, returned by a hash function
a method used to produce hash code from any data of arbitrary size to data of fixed size
a number represented by the base of 16
HyperText Markup Language; a web content presentation language
HyperText Transfer Protocol (Secure); a protocol that defines all rules how the browser should communicate with a server
a name of a class, variable, method or interface defined in the code by the software developer - String identifier = \"Some string\";
a Java control structure used to choose if execution of further actions should continue or not
an object whose state or value is not changeable after creation
a Java keyword used to indicate which interfaces are implemented by the current class
a statement used to enable the use of other classes or interfaces from different Java packages - import java.util.*;
a recursion that happens when method A calls method B while a call from the method B to the method A is still in progress
a recursion that can technically continue indefinitely; it very often indicates a logic error and can lead to StackOverflow errors
a feature of object-oriented programming, where classes contain all variables and methods defined in their supertypes
a Java primitive of the type integer - int number = 10;
a Java keyword used to define the collection of methods and constant values that can be furthermore implemented by other classes
a single execution of a loop
Java Archive is the default Java packaging mechanism to aggregate multiple files into one (similar to .zip)
provides the main features of Java, also named Java Standard Edition
Java Enterprise Edition
Java Development Kit, the environment and core libraries used to write Java programs
Java Virtual Machine, the abstract machine where the compiled Java bytecode is executed
a situation when two separate threads are waiting for each other to check the condition of particular part of the program
a variable defined in the method body, visible only inside it
a Java primitive of the type long - long bigNumber = 100L;
a starting point for Java applications - public static void main(String[] args){}

a situation during the program execution where memory that is no longer being used cannot be removed by the garbage collector as there is still a reference to it; it eventually leads to OutOfMemoryException
a particular function implemented in a Java class - public int doSthAndReturnInt();
a group of program components; in Java, the term that’s used for it is package
a program capable of concurrent execution on multiple threads
this happens when two methods are calling each other recursively at the same time
an area of the program defined by packages, with established certain visibility rules (e.g. private access, public access, etc.)
a keyword indicating that particular method is not implemented in Java language itself, but in another programming language
a class, which is implemented inside the body of the other class
the operator used to create an instance of a class
a type indicating that object reference variable has no reference to any object existing in memory
an instance of a particular class; also the core concept of the OOP
Object Oriented Programming – a primary paradigm in modern software development, focused on objects as primitives, not the specific actions; each object is created/instantiated from a class
a symbol used for arithmetic or boolean expressions, e.g. +,-,/,*,=
the order of processing conditions or equations with the multiple operators, similar to the mathematical concept of order of operations
using the same method name for various implementation, differentiated by parameters
providing a different implementation of the original method in its subclass
a name for a grouping of classes and interfaces in a namespace
one of the following non-class variable type - boolean, byte, char, double, float, int, long or short
a Java modifier, used to specify the visibility of a method or a variable, so they can be accessed only within its class
another modifier that makes variables or classes accessible to all other elements in the same package
a modifier allowing external access to a particular variable or method
a process where a method is invoked again from its existing call stack
the ability of the code to inspect and manipulate other code in the same runtime process
a Java keyword used to finish the execution of the method and return data back to the caller
it determines the visibility of elements in the program, for example, local or global variables
the process of encoding and decoding the objects to the stream of bytes, and vice-versa
a keyword used to specify the variable of the type short - short num = 2;
class member variable stored and accessed as a single instance for all objects of that class
a byte-stream of data sent from sender to receiver
an instance of an immutable String class, containing zero or more Unicode characters - String myText = "Hello... It's me.";
a keyword allowing the access to members of a class inherited by the class in which it appears
a control structure with multiple cases
a control statement that guarantees single-access semantics in a multithreaded environment
a statement that references the instance of the class where it appears
a basic, single lightweight execution process supported natively by the JVM as well as by the OS
a statement used to throw an Exception
a keyword in a method header indicating that one or more exceptions will be propagated from this method
an error without handler defined in the program implementation, cannot be dealt with at compilation time
a 16-bit character set defined by ISO 10646, designed to make exchange and display of information easier across various languages
Uniform Resource Identifier/Locator. You can read more about the difference between these two concepts here
a process of casting to super type – for example from String to Object
an item of data associated with a specific type
the place in the application, where the specific variable is assigned to one of the existing Java types
see JVM
a keyword used to indicate that method does not return any value
a modifier specifying how the variable behaves in a multithreaded environment; the variable will never be cached in a thread-local – as it’s expected to be modified by different threads
a Java control structure used for looping
an object that encapsulates primitive types into one of the classes from the java.lang package - Boolean, Byte, Character, Double, Float, Integer, Long or Short to provide additional methods
